com.tomzhu.hash

Class HashTableByLinearProbing<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomzhu.hash.HashTableByLinearProbing<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - the type of key
    V - the type of value

    public class HashTableByLinearProbing<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    a simple hash table implementation by linear probing where h(i) = i. the importance of hash table implementation by linear probing is the load factor and rehash, the load factor for linear probing is set as less than 0.5. For linear probing strategy, the table size doesn't need to be a prime while for quadratic strategy, a primed table size is necessary. see HashTableByQuadraticProbing for more detail. Another important issue is the lazy-deletion when removing a pair from this map.
    Since:
    1.7
    Author:
    tomzhu
    See Also:
    HashTableByQuadraticProbing
